citations.narrative:
Representatives advised they took into their possession a 4-yr-old black spider monkey on June 11, 2021 and it was kept
until approximately August 28, 2022 when they returned it to the original owner. During the timeframe of possession, the
animal had occasionally been exhibited to friends and members of the public from approximately mid-November 2021
until mid-July 2022.
Spider monkeys require specific USDA authorization.
A licensee must obtain a new license before using any animal beyond those types or numbers of animals authorized
under the existing license.
Correct by February 1, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
Additional Inspectors:
LYNNE WHITE-SHIM, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section

narrative:
2.1(b)(2)(ii) 
   
Requirements and application 
Representatives advised they took into their possession a 4-yr-old black spider monkey on June 11, 2021 and it was kept 
until approximately August 28, 2022 when they returned it to the original owner. During the timeframe of possession, the 
animal had occasionally been exhibited to friends and members of the public from approximately mid-November 2021 
until mid-July 2022. 
 
Spider monkeys require specific USDA authorization. 
 
A licensee must obtain a new license before using any animal beyond those types or numbers of animals authorized 
under the existing license. 
 
Correct by February 1, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.

Additional Inspectors: 
LYNNE WHITE-SHIM, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICEREnd Section
